text:
The Wireless Experience to Offer DIRECTV
The Wireless Experience, a premier authorized AT&T retailer will offer the DIRECTV bundle in addition to AT&T wireless and home services in their over 60 locations throughout the US.
Toms River, NJ, August 28, 2015 --( PR.com )-- Two weeks after acquiring DIRECTV, AT&T, which became the largest pay TV provider in the United States, released its first package. Available starting August 10th, the bundle combines mobile and television services making it the “first-ever nationwide package of TV and wireless services.”
The $200 plan includes four wireless accounts with 10GB of shareable data and television service with high definition video and digital video recording service. The promotional price presents an annual savings of up to $600 for the first 12 months. Subscribers will be able to view content across mobile, video, and broadband platforms.
AT&T will be selling DIRECTV at 2,000 AT&T retail stores and authorized retailers nationwide. The Wireless Experience, a premier authorized AT&T retailer will offer the DIRECTV bundle in addition to AT&T wireless and home services in their over 60 locations throughout the US.
"This merger opens the door for a brand new type of service, and allows AT&T and The Wireless Experience to grow and adapt to meet ever changing needs of the mobile consumer. Whether they want traditional TV service, mobile streaming of their favorite content, or the big game streamed live over the Internet to any screen, we can now get the content to the consumer wherever they go,” said Brian Wainwright, President of The Wireless Experience.
About The Wireless Experience
Headquartered in New Jersey, The Wireless Experience is a premier wireless solution and home automation AT&T retailer operating over 60 stores across the Northeast. To learn more about The Wireless Experience visit www.thewirelessexperience.com or call 1800-NEW-TALK.
